description: Changing people’s lives through their skin. JOYA is the only preventative skin health and wellness platform. Driving better access and lowering cost.
problem_statement: limited access and cost to simply have better skin

market_opportunity.justification:
Target customer: Anyone with skin - People Dont know where to go, what to get and if they can afford treatments for better skin
Market size: TAM is 32M consumers

product_differentiation.justification:
Competitors: nobody is doing what we are doing in both the DTC and B2B space
In-market since: yes - 2.5 years

go_to_market_traction.justification:
Traction: ~500K in ARR
Customers: 22 paying customers - we have 86 in our pipeline equating $1.5M to $4.5M in ARR
Pricing: 50% are fully subsidizing it to all their employees (@ $10 PEPM) the other 50% are passing it on as a voluntary benefit (paying @$25 PMPM)

ecosystem_signals.justification:
Program source: las vegas meeting
Referral: na

founder_team_strength.justification:
Co-founders: Mike Jafar Founder https://www.linkedin.com/in/michaeljafar/
Tech team: our head of product, full time full stack engineer and a group of outsourced engineers are responsible for our tech stack

strategic_fit.justification: Aligned with SV’s thesis around digital transformation and workforce innovation.

red_flags: revenue / broker management is our biggest blindspot

founder_profile.name: [Mike Jafar Founder https://www.linkedin.com/in/michaeljafar/](https://www.linkedin.com/in/michaeljafar/)
highlights: Founder has demonstrated commitment to solving a real market pain, often with personal or domain-driven insight.
Team typically includes technical or domain-specific expertise relevant to their solution.
Backgrounds show a mix of startup, academic, or operator experience that informs their execution approach.

founder_impact_assessment: focus on building or fixing not managing the status quo

sector_fit.justification: Aligned with SV’s macro thesis on workforce transformation, digital enablement, and operational efficiency.

employer_ecosystem_leverage.justification: Could integrate into SV portfolio employer use cases or distribution channels—especially those focused on talent, productivity, or care delivery.

gtm_support_potential.justification: guide our scale plan and influence v2 of our product

strategic_partner_amplification.justification: Potential partnerships with other SV-backed platforms and vendors targeting the same buyer.

acceleration_readiness.justification: Product and team are early but show clear focus, alignment, and testable GTM hypotheses. Well-positioned for structured SV support.

successes_and_areas_of_investigation.description: revenue / broker management is our biggest blindspot

category_comparison: JOYA Health positions itself against legacy and niche solutions. Its competitive advantage is built on integration, UX, and customer-centric outcomes.

primary_competitors.name: Incumbent Providers
primary_competitors.description: Traditional solutions or services that lack personalization, automation, or modern UX.
primary_competitors.comparison: This company differentiates via digital-first, user-centric, or AI-driven design. This competitor often lacks the depth or product flexibility needed to address evolving employer or operational requirements.

primary_competitors.name: Point Solutions
primary_competitors.description: Niche vendors addressing one aspect of the problem.
primary_competitors.comparison: This company offers a more integrated or holistic experience. This competitor often lacks the depth or product flexibility needed to address evolving employer or operational requirements.

category_comparison_expanded.conclusion: JOYA Health is positioned well in its category with a differentiated product. With further traction and partnerships, it could emerge as a category leader.

final_recommendation.rationale: Pending deeper review, financial validation, and external signal confirmation.
